title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2005.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2005.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Part: (a) Adjudicatory proceeding means any
activity which is not a rule making proceeding or a disciplinary action before
the corporation in which a determination of the legal rights, duties or
privileges of named parties thereto is required by statute to be made only
after an opportunity for a hearing. (b) Person means any individual, partnership, corporation, association or public or private organization of any character
other than the corporation. (c) Party means any person or agency named or admitted as a party or properly
seeking and entitled as of right to be admitted as a party; but nothing in this

Part shall be construed to prevent the agency from admitting any person as a
party for limited purposes. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
2005.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
